question: Which of the following represents a template or blueprint that defines objects of the same type?
How do you call a method in a parent class?
Which statement about inheritance is incorrect?
options: A. Inheritance is a key idea of Object-oriented programming (OOP).
B. The child class is also called a subclass or a derived class.
C. Private members of a class can be inherited.
D. Public members of a class can be inherited.
answer: A. Inheritance is a key idea of Object-oriented programming (OOP).
